Karunanidhi government issued an order allowing any Hindu, regardless of caste, to become an Archaka in temples administered by the HR&CE department, provided they had the required training. To implement this order, it constituted a seven-member high-level committee on June 10, 2006, under the chairmanship of Justice (Retired) A.K. Rajan

title: UCF's Frost: Nebraska job 'wasn't a good move'

content: Chelsea's João Pedro marked his first start in spectacular fashion on Tuesday, scoring twice to send the Premier League side into the Club World Cup final with a 2-0 victory over his boyhood club Fluminense.

content: Newcaslte have agreed a £55 million deal with Nottingham Forest for winger Anthony Elanga, a source has told ESPN.

content: Italy and Juventus great Giorgio Chiellini has joined LAFC's ownership group, the MLS club announced Tuesday.

title: Investigation clears Bay FC coach Montoya
content: An independent investigation found that Bay FC coach Albertin Montoya did not violate the National Women's Soccer League's antiharassment, discrimination and bullying policy, but found shortcomings in his communication style.

title: Sources: Madrid ask LaLiga to delay opener
content: Real Madrid have asked LaLiga for their league opener against Osasuna to be rescheduled because of their involvement in the FIFA Club World Cup, sources have told ESPN.

title: Trump to attend Club World Cup final at MetLife
content: U .S. President Donald Trump will attend Sunday's Club World Cup final in East Rutherford, New Jersey, he said at a Cabinet meeting on Tuesday, as world soccer's ruling body FIFA announced it had opened an office in New York's Trump Tower.

title: Langur Enters West Bengal School, Flees After Attacking Teacher
content: The teacher, Gobardhan Bhuniya, was taking a class when the langur suddenly entered the classroom and a commotion broke out among students to get out when the langur attacked. The teacher was injured and rushed to Midnapore Medical College Hospital.

title: Indian Nurse Nimisha Priya, On Death Row In Yemen, To Be Executed On July 16
content: Nimisha Priya, the Indian nurse who is on death row after being convicted for the murder of a Yemeni national, will be executed next week on July 16.

title: Iran Nuclear Programme "Very Delayed" By Strikes: French Intel Chief
content: Iran's nuclear programme has been "very, very delayed" by US and Israeli strikes, France's foreign intelligence chief said on Tuesday, wading into a contentious debate over just how hard it was hit.

title: Asia's Oldest Elephant Dies At Panna Tiger Reserve
content: Vatsala, the Asia's oldest female elephant, who earned names -- Dadi Maa, Nani Maa in her life journey of more than 100 years from Kerala to Madhya Pradesh, died at the Panna Tiger Reserve (PTR) on Tuesday.

title: PM Modi Conferred With Brazil's Highest Civilian Award

The ₹44,000 cr. figure is only for a two-year period and the total amount could be much more as the firm has operated here for five years, she says

content: Party submits report to J.P. Nadda, alleges tampering of victim’s complaint; calls for Mamata Banerjee to take responsibility

title: Bharat Bandh: Centre says several unions backed off from strike; unions refute claim
content: A source in the Union Labour Ministry claims 213 unions have informed the Ministry that they will not participate in the strike, called by 10 Central Trade Unions over a 17-point demand charter, including scrapping of the four Labour Codes. The unions say though many unions have not given strike notices, the workers will take part in the strike

title: Accused in two terror attacks in India used online payment services, e-commerce platforms, VPNs: terror financing watchdog’s report
content: The global money laundering and terrorist financing watchdog cites the ‘lone actor’ attack on security personnel at at Gorakhnath Temple in Uttar Pradesh on April 3, 2022, and the Pulwama suicide-bomb attack in February 2019 which killed 40 CRPF personnel

title: NGO asks SC to take judicial notice of lawyers withdrawing consent to become HC judges due to government delay, segregation
content: The statement asked what the point of rigorous interviews and background checks by the SC Collegium was when the government would eventually delay appointments for unknown reasons or ‘pick and choose’ names

title: EPFO to complete process of crediting interest for FY25 this week: Minister
content: For the current year, the Central Government’s approval to credit interest at 8.25% on EPF accumulations came on May 22, 2025

title: BJP demands apology from Kharge over remarks on President Murmu
content: Congress accused of “anti-tribal and anti-Dalit mindset”; BJP says President’s office insulted by party chief’s comments

title: Bike taxi riders urge Karnataka to adopt central guidelines
content: The Centre has permitted ride-hailing platforms to include “non-transport motorcycles” under their services in its updated guidelines for taxi aggregators, even as states like Karnataka continue to enforce a ban on bike taxis.

title: Guntur will be made a poverty-free district through P4, says Minister
content: Kandula Durgesh directs officials and elected representatives to intensify outreach of welfare schemes and ensure timely delivery of services

content: Officials say Tribal Affairs Ministry will reach out with scholarship offers for them and give handholding for application process

title: Bihar Special Intensive Revision: Five of 11 documents sought do not show date or place of birth

title: Reopening HAL airport does not excite us: HAL chief

title: Manipur High Court asks NIA to submit progress report on Jiribam abduction, killing of women and children
content: The court said if the chargesheet was not filed seven months after the incident, it ‘should be viewed seriously’

title: Kanaka Durga temple shines in green as Sakambari festival gets off to a colourful start
content: 50 tonnes of vegetables used on the first day for temple decoration and preparation of Kadambam, the special prasadam associated with the festival; devotees from A.P. and various parts of India are arriving in large numbers to witness the unique celebration, which will conclude on July 10

title: Bharat Bandh today: Public services likely to be hit; 10 things to know about nationwide strike
content: Ten central trade unions have called for a nationwide strike, Bharat Bandh, on Wednesday, supported by rural and agricultural labor organizations. The unions are protesting government policies favoring big businesses at the expense of workers and farmers. They are demanding better wages, more government jobs, and opposing new labor codes, potentially disrupting public transport and services.

title: Bihar Mahagathbandhan protest: Tyres burnt, roads blocked; what electoral roll row is about
content: The Mahagathbandhan alliance in Bihar launched a "Bihar Bandh" to protest the Election Commission's special intensive revision of electoral rolls. Opposition leaders like Rahul Gandhi and Tejashwi Yadav led rallies, alleging the revision disenfranchises marginalized voters ahead of upcoming elections.

title: 'I stay in Delhi for two or three days only,' says Nitin Gadkari; explains why
content: Union minister Nitin Gadkari voiced concerns about Delhi's escalating pollution, impacting public health and life expectancy. Speaking at 'Ek Ped Maa Ke Naam 2.0' tree plantation drive, he emphasised the urgent need to curb vehicle emissions. Gadkari highlighted government initiatives promoting alternative fuels like ethanol, large-scale plantation drives, and utilising waste in road construction.

title: UAE Golden Visa confusion: Has a Rs 23 lakh special visa really been launched?
content: Reports of a new, cheaper UAE golden visa pilot program targeting Indian and Bangladeshi citizens have sparked excitement and confusion. Despite widespread circulation in Indian media, UAE authorities have not confirmed any policy changes.

title: Satya Nadella column: Cricket in USA - Not an arrival, but a homecoming
content: Satya Nadella, Chairman and CEO of Microsoft and co-owner of MLC franchise Seattle Orcas, highlights the excitement surrounding cricket globally. In this guest column, he reminisces about his childhood cricket experiences in Hyderabad and draws parallels between cricket and leadership. Microsoft's involvement with the Seattle Orcas and the England and Wales Cricket Board shows commitment to growing the sport.

title: Rocket shocker: US Air Force halts SpaceX project; Reason same as why Musk skipped omelette …
content: The U.S. Air Force has suspended its plan to collaborate with SpaceX for hypersonic rocket cargo deliveries from Johnston Atoll due to environmental concerns. Biologists and experts feared the project would endanger numerous seabirds nesting on the remote Pacific wildlife refuge.

title: Alia Bhatt duped of Rs 76.9 lakh: Ex-secretary arrested; was absconding for 5 months
content: Alia Bhatt's former secretary, Vedika Shetty, has been arrested for allegedly embezzling ₹76.9 lakh from the actress's accounts over two years. Soni Razdan, Bhatt's mother, filed the complaint, leading to Shetty's capture in Bengaluru after five months on the run. Police report Shetty forged signatures and financial documents while managing Bhatt's affairs.

title: 'I just coloured my beard two days ago... ': Virat Kohli breaks silence on Test retirement
content: Yuvraj Singh's YouWeCan Foundation gala dinner in London saw a gathering of cricket legends, including Sachin Tendulkar, Chris Gayle, and the Indian cricket team led by Gautam Gambhir. Virat Kohli made a surprise appearance, reminiscing about his Test retirement and praising Ravi Shastri's crucial support during his career.

title: Shubman Gill mirrors Virat Kohli's career: From U-19 to Test captaincy records
content: Shubman Gill's career path shows striking similarities to Virat Kohli's. Both excelled in Under-19 World Cups and achieved centuries across all formats. They reached top ODI rankings and demonstrated consistent batting. Gill and Kohli share uncanny parallels in IPL performances and Test achievements. These coincidences highlight Gill's potential to inspire future cricketers, much like Kohli.

title: What Microsoft said on shutting down its 25-year-old operations in Pakistan
content: Microsoft has ended its operations in Pakistan after a quarter century. The company is changing its operational model. It will now serve customers through resellers and other Microsoft offices nearby. This decision impacts five employees in Pakistan. Jawwad Rehman, the former country head, expressed concern about the business environment.

title: ‘Guardian of our jungles’: Asia’s oldest female elephant dies; was over 100 years old
content: Vatsala, believed to be Asia's oldest female elephant at over 100 years, passed away at Panna Tiger Reserve, Madhya Pradesh. Chief Minister Mohan Yadav paid tribute to Vatsala, highlighting her role as a guardian of the forests and a symbol of the state's emotions. The elephant, brought from Kerala, was cremated with full honors.

title: New Mexico floods: Houses swept away, river overflows as rain hits Ruidoso village - watch
content: Ruidoso, New Mexico, faced devastating flash floods, sweeping away homes and stranding residents. Emergency crews performed 85 swift-water rescues as floodwaters submerged roads and entered homes. The Rio Ruidoso surged nearly 19 feet, prompting warnings for residents to seek higher ground. The area, vulnerable due to prior wildfires, experienced even higher floodwaters than last summer, impacting previously unaffected areas.

title: 'Had to come out alive': Himachal woman survives 5 hours under landslide debris
content: In Himachal's Mandi district, Tuneja Thakur, a 20-year-old woman, displayed incredible resilience after being buried in a landslide. For five hours, she clawed through mud and debris, creating a breathing space and digging her way out. Her determination to survive amidst the devastating flash floods has been hailed as a miracle, with officials praising her courage.

title: Elon Musk reacts as Bill Gates again raises alarm on USAID funding cut killing children
content: Bill Gates expressed concerns over potential health aid cuts by the US government, warning of increased deaths. Elon Musk responded sharply, suggesting Gates' unhappiness stemmed from his organization losing US taxpayer funding. This exchange is the latest in a series of disagreements, fueled by Gates' past short position against Tesla stock, which reportedly cost him $1.5 billion.

title: IND vs ENG: England ka koi ego vego nahi hai? R Ashwin blasts 'Bazballers'
content: Indian spinner R Ashwin has criticized Brendon McCullum's 'Bazball' coaching approach, arguing its New Zealand-centric style is failing England. Ashwin highlights the differences between New Zealand and England pitches, emphasizing the importance of seam and swing in England.

title: Are heart palpitations dangerous? Here's what we know
content: Heart palpitations feel like your heart is racing, fluttering, pounding, or skipping beats. You might notice these sensations in your chest, throat, or neck. They can happen during physical activity or even when you are resting. They usually last for a few seconds to minutes, but can sometimes last longer.

title: Top stocks to buy: Stock recommendations for today - check list
content: Stock market recommendations: Mehul Kothari from Anand Rathi Shares recommends buying AAVAS Financiers, citing a strong base formation and potential breakout towards ₹2300. He also suggests Jyothy Labs due to a double bottom confirmation and possible retest of ₹400 levels. Additionally, Varun Beverages Limited is recommended for an oversold bounce with a target of ₹490.

title: Dayton Bramhall cut again — legacy Disney daughter’s emotional Netflix journey
content: Dayton Bramhall, daughter of Shelly, faced challenges in her DCC journey. She auditioned thrice but was cut each time. Despite her family's DCC legacy, she needed to earn her place. The rejection strained relationships, especially with her mother. Dayton now teaches at The Young Company in Texas. She empowers young dancers with her experiences.

title: Colin Kaepernick: 'I'm not quitting'—daily training for NFL comeback
content: Colin Kaepernick, now 37, declares his readiness to return to the NFL after an eight-year absence. Despite last playing in 2017, he maintains a rigorous training schedule and believes he can still be a starting quarterback. Kaepernick awaits an opportunity, remaining optimistic that the right team will call, even after years away from the game.

title: Russell Wilson’s wife Ciara rocks ‘classic’ pink Adidas outfit - seals style icon status
content: Ciara recently captivated fans with a retro-inspired look, sporting a pink Adidas tracksuit and debuting a striking new hairstyle, drawing admiration from her husband, Russell Wilson. The singer has been making fashion headlines, from Knicks games to London trips. Simultaneously, Ciara is gearing up for her album release, 'CiCi,' on August 22, featuring collaborations with Normani and Teyana Taylor.

title: Scuffle in Armenian Parliament: Lawmakers trade blows; watch chaotic scenes unfold
content: Political tensions in Armenia escalated as a brawl erupted in the National Assembly following an opposition lawmaker's call for President Pashinyan's ouster. Artur Sargsyan, accused of plotting to overthrow the government, had his parliamentary immunity stripped.

title: 'Men fought wars ...': Congress MLA's ‘eunuch’ jibe at RSS triggers row; BJP's retort
content: During a Congress protest in Ashoknagar, MLA Sahab Singh Gurjar made a controversial statement, drawing criticism for sexism and insulting the third gender. His remarks, linking men's participation in war to eunuchs joining the Sangh, sparked outrage. The BJP strongly condemned Gurjar's statement, questioning if similar language would be used for absent Congress leaders and denouncing the protest as vulgar.

title: 'We would run it so good': Is Trump hinting at taking over New York City and Washington?
content: Donald Trump suggested the federal government might seize control of New York City and Washington D.C., citing concerns about crime and ineffective local leadership. He criticized New York's ranked-choice voting and claimed the White House possesses the authority to intervene in cities if necessary. Despite data showing a decrease in violent crime in D.C.

title: 2.2 hours per day: Screen time of Indian kids 2x safe limit, claims study
content: A recent study reveals that Indian children under 5 spend an average of 2.2 hours daily on screens, exceeding recommended limits. This excessive screen time is linked to developmental delays and behavioral issues. Experts advise parents to establish tech-free zones, limit screen time, and engage children in offline activities to mitigate these negative impacts and promote healthy development.

title: India need to play Kuldeep... they are missing variation: Kevin Pietersen | Exclusive
content: Amidst discussions about Kuldeep Yadav's absence, Kevin Pietersen advocates for his inclusion in India's playing XI for the Lord's Test, emphasizing the need for variation in the bowling attack. Pietersen, who mentored Yadav at Delhi Capitals, shared insights into their discussions about bowling tactics in England.

title: Trump says more trade-related announcements coming Wednesday
content: President Trump is escalating trade tensions by issuing tariff letters to multiple countries, including Japan and South Korea, imposing duties ranging from 25% to 40%. He accuses these nations of unfair trade practices and threatens further increases if they retaliate.

title: 'Sitaare Zameen Par' collection day 19: Film mints Rs 151.90 cr in India
content: Aamir Khan and Genelia D’Souza’s ‘Sitaare Zameen Par’ continues its box office success, earning close to Rs. 2 crore on its third Tuesday. The film's total collection in India has reached Rs. 151.90 crore across all languages. Despite new releases and a weekday dip, the heartwarming drama maintains a strong audience hold, showcasing the struggles and strengths of neurodivergent kids through a sports narrative.

title: Kyunki Saas Bhi Kabhi Bahu Thi 3: Smriti Irani's pay jumps from Rs 1800 to Rs 14 lakh per episode; reports
content: The iconic show Kyunki Saas Bhi Kabhi Bahu Thi is making a comeback with its second season, featuring the original lead pair, Amar Upadhyay and Smriti Irani. Smriti Irani, reprising her role as Tulsi Virani, is reportedly being paid a whopping Rs 14 lakh per episode. The reboot is set to premiere from July 29 at 10:30 PM.

title: Over half of school kids struggle with basics, reveals government survey
content: A recent PARAKH Rashtriya Sarvekshan reveals significant learning gaps among Indian schoolchildren. A large percentage of students in Classes VI and IX struggle with basic math, language comprehension, and science concepts. The survey, encompassing over 21 lakh students across India, highlights persistent rural-urban and gender disparities, with varying performance levels among states and school types.

title: Milan airport horror: Man dies after being sucked into aircraft's engine
content: A man, believed to be around 35, tragically died after being sucked into a plane engine at Milan Bergamo Airport. He breached security, accessing the aircraft parking zones after abandoning his car near the terminal. Authorities have confirmed he was neither a passenger nor airport staff.

title: Brics rejects EU's unilateral carbon border tax proposal
content: BRICS nations have strongly condemned the European Union's carbon border tax, deeming it discriminatory and a barrier to their development. They argue the CBAM, set to begin next year, unfairly burdens developing countries and disrupts global trade.

title: Punjab bill proposes life term if acts of sacrilege lead to riots, deaths
content: The Punjab government, led by Bhagwant Mann, has drafted a strict anti-sacrilege law, the 'Punjab Prevention of Offences Against Holy Scripture(s) Act, 2025'. It proposes life imprisonment for desecrating holy scriptures like the Guru Granth Sahib, Gita, Quran, and Bible. Guardians could be liable if juveniles or differently-abled individuals under their care commit sacrilege.

title: Textiles exporters face fresh trade uncertainty amid Trump's latest announcements
content: New US tariffs have created market uncertainty, potentially benefiting Indian textile exporters over Bangladesh. However, concerns remain about competition from China and the need for government support. Industry seeks zero duty on key exports, hoping a trade deal with the US will improve competitiveness, especially in synthetic garments, despite existing cost disadvantages and capacity limitations.

title: Trade war: China warns nations against siding with US on supply chain shifts
content: China has cautioned the US against reimposing tariffs, warning of retaliation against nations aligning with Washington to exclude Beijing from global supply chains. The warning, published in the People's Daily, criticizes the US tariff strategy as "bullying."

title: Jonas Valanciunas uncertain trade — Denver’s backup center plan stalls
content: Denver Nuggets' trade for Jonas Valanciunas faces uncertainty. Valanciunas hints at a possible move to Panathinaikos in Greece. This creates confusion about his NBA future. The Nuggets have not officially confirmed the deal. Valanciunas is under contract, but his intentions are unclear. Denver expects him to honor his agreement. The team has made other key additions this offseason.

title: Trump says more tariff letters coming, warns no extension beyond August 1
content: Donald Trump announced new tariffs on foreign imports. These tariffs will be effective from August 1, 2025. He stated no further extensions would be granted. Letters outlining tariffs have been sent to various countries. These countries include Japan, South Korea and others. The tariffs range from 25 to 40 percent. This is unless trade deals are reached before the deadline.

title: Nine players who will score more TDs in 2025
content: 169 instances in which a wide receiver or tight end scored fewer than five touchdowns on 50-plus offensive touches before managing at least 50 touches the very next season . of those 169, 114 (67.5%) scored more touchdowns the next season, focusing in on the 48 players in that group who scored less than three touchdowns during the first year .

title: 'Gift of this new little life': Tim Tebow and wife Demi-Leigh welcome newborn daughter
content: daphne Reign Tebow's middle name is inspired by a young girl they admire . "we couldn't be more grateful for the blessing and gift of this new little life," he wrote . the couple announced the birth of their daughter in a joint Instagram post .

content: welterweight boxer Jack Catterall won his debut by technical decision over Harlem Eubank . a cut caused by a clash of heads ended the fight prematurely . his departure from 140 pounds makes room for dalton Smith to enter the rankings at No. 10 .

content: Mauricio Pochettino says a penalty should have been given for handball . the united states lost 2-1 to Mexico in the concacaf gold cup final on sunday . lvarez's goal was initially ruled out for offside, but the referee and the VAR ignored claims .

content: the compressed offseason is an opportunity for every front office to improve its roster . some general managers need just a few players to remain a top Stanley Cup contender . others need to be a bit more aggressive to raise their club's competitive level .
